intro: Sericanthe toupetou, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in shrubland and forest edges, preferring well-drained soil. The leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a glossy appearance.
